sourceDesc.p: Created by members of the TLS project

tls:text.tls:line: who passed it down?
who passed it down?
The story of the far-off, ancient beginnings of things
The story of the far-off, ancient beginnings of things
What was it like before the sky above and the earth below had taken shape,
What was it like before the sky above and the earth below had taken shape,
how can we be sure.
Since none could penetreate,
Since none could penetreate,
are the darkness and light?
and how could they originate and transform all things that are by their commingling?
and how could they originate and transform all things that are by their commingling?
Whose work was this,
and how did he accomplish it?
and how did he accomplish it?
and how did he accomplish it?

sense.def: set up, originate (something), create, invent; produce; of texts: compose

tls:text.tls:line: Where were the circling chords fastened,
and where was the sky's pole fixed?
and where was the sky's pole fixed?
Where did the Eight Pillars meet the sky,

sense.def: pillar (holding something up); the four posts at the four corners of the house which hold up the whole structure

tls:text.tls:line: Where did the Eight Pillars meet the sky,
and why were they too short for it in the south-east?

sense.def: why? (assumed answer: surely there is no good reason!)

tls:text.tls:line: who knows their number?
who knows their number?
13 How does heaven coordinate its motions?
Where are the Twelve Houses divided?
How do the sun and the moon hold to their courses

sense.def: how? (idiomatic in 安得 "how can one get to?", 安敢"how would I dare to?"

tls:text.tls:line: and the fixed stars keep their places?

sense.def: how? (idiomatic in 安得 "how can one get to?", 安敢"how would I dare to?"

tls:text.tls:line: how many miles is the journey?

sense.def: how many N(on the face of the earth...)?

tls:text.tls:line: Of what advantage is it
without a union?
Where is Lord Bluster, the Wind Star,

sense.def: in which object (on earty)> where in the world?

tls:text.tls:line: Where is Lord Bluster, the Wind Star,

sense.def: find oneself in (a condition, at a time); occupy (a position or an office)

tls:text.tls:line: and where does the warm wind live?
21 What is it whose closing causes the dark
and whose opening causes the light?
before the Horn proclaims the dawning of the day?
why was he given this charge?

sense.def: why on earth? surely for no good reason!

tls:text.tls:line: All said, 'Never fear!

sense.def: why? (assumed answer: surely there is no good reason!)

tls:text.tls:line: All said, 'Never fear!

sense.def: why? (assumed answer: surely there is no good reason!)

tls:text.tls:line: Try him out and see if he can do it.'

sense.def: you surely should, why don't you

tls:text.tls:line: how did Gǔn follow their sign?

sense.def: why? (assumed answer: surely there is no good reason!)

tls:text.tls:line: why did the high lord punish him?

sense.def: why? (assumed answer: surely there is no good reason!)

tls:text.tls:line: how was he transformed?
how was he transformed?

sense.def: change and be transformed, undergo all sorts of changes and transformations

tls:text.tls:line: 17 What is the peculiar virtue of the moon, the Brightness of the Night,

sense.def: what N on earth? i.e. none of the N kind

tls:text.tls:line: why for three whole years did he not rot?
If he continued the work already begun,

sense.def: why? (assumed answer: surely there is no good reason!)

tls:text.tls:line: Where did the seas and rivers flow?
Where did the seas and rivers flow?
33 What did Gǔn plan
33 What did Gǔn plan
and what did Yǔ accomplish?
did the earth sink down towards the south-east?

sense.def: for what reason? (surely one does not know!)

tls:text.tls:line: Why are the lands of the earth dry

sense.def: why on earth? (surely one does not know why!)

tls:text.tls:line: from east to west and from north to south?
What is the difference between its length and breath?
with its Hanging Garden?
are its ninefold walls?

sense.def: how many N(on the face of the earth...)?

tls:text.tls:line: the gates in its four sides?
what wind is it that passes through?
What land does the sun not shine on

sense.def: mildly rhetorical: to which place on the face of the earth

tls:text.tls:line: and how does the Torch Dragon light it?
What place is warm in winter?
What place is cold in summer?
And made plain whatever was doubtful in the laws.
And made plain whatever was doubtful in the laws.
And made plain whatever was doubtful in the laws.
When you turn your back on all actions and let your sole heart rule,
When you turn your back on all actions and let your sole heart rule,
Why have the sweet flowers died so soon?Why have the sweet flowers died so soon?

sense.def: Chì Sōng 赤松 (legendary, no dates) also called 赤松子, in HNZ 9 赤誦子, is a widely acclaimed immortal, traditionally identified with the deity Master of Rain 雨師. Xu Shen’s commentary on HNZ 12 reports that he left for the mountains because he fell ill, and that he practised the art of levitation. He is said to have lived during the time of the Divine Husbandman >Shen Nong 神農. CC praises him as having purified himself of the dust of this world. (tr. Hawkes p. 194). In CC 11.1 and 14.1 he is mentioned, as often elsewhere, together with >Wang Qiao 王喬. HSWZ 5.27 has him as the teacher of >Emperor Ku 帝嚳. He is said to be in charge of rainfall and also a specialist in respiratory techniques. In Liexianzhuan 列仙傳 [ed. Kaltenmark 1987, 35, ed. Wang Shumin p. 1] he is celebrated in the opening entry as being able to walk through fire and as frequenting Xiwangmu 西王母 . The youngest daughter of Emperor Yan of the Shang 商炎帝 is said to have pursued him amorously and to have achieved immortality that way. [HNZ 11.13b and 20.10a, BHT 15, tr. Tjan p. 483]

tls:text.tls:line: With me the love of beauty is my constant joy.

sense.def: be especially fond of; find especially attractive; show a special preference for

tls:text.tls:line: 75 The lovely daughters of noble families, far exelling common maidens.
Seeing the bahaviour of orchid and pepper-flower,

sense.def: win control over by force, successfully fight for control over (a state etc)
wield the butcher's knife> work as a butcher
dust; sand; (also abstractly in a transferred sense: defilement)
the dust of this dirty world

tls:text.tls:line: 40 So Zǐ Xū died; but afterwards he was sorry.

sense.def: breath; breath and inner vital energies, breath and spirits; vital spirits of a person
司馬彪：陰、隔、風、雨丶晦、明

tls:text.tls:line: ‘Glorious Heaven, never partial or fawning –
‘Glorious Heaven, never partial or fawning –
and so defame me with propensity to vice.

sense.def: be lecherous; commit acts of dissolute lewdness; commit acts of adultery or promiscuity
even if, contrary to conceivable fact

tls:line.title: The Songs of Chu.A Anthology of Ancient Chinese Poetry by Qu Yuan and Others

tls:text.tls:line: Who among them cares to look inside our hearts?

sense.def: who among them?, which one?; (contrastive) who?

tls:text.tls:line: for who can rightly discern our inner convictions?
for who can rightly discern our inner convictions?

tls:line.title: The Songs of Chu.A Anthology of Ancient Chinese Poetry by Qu Yuan and Others

tls:text.tls:line: Who can be employed who is unprincipled?

sense.def: who among them?, which one?; (contrastive) who?

tls:line.title: The Songs of Chu.A Anthology of Ancient Chinese Poetry by Qu Yuan and Others

tls:text.tls:line: Beautiful indeed she is, but lacks decorum.

tls:line.title: The Songs of Chu.A Anthology of Ancient Chinese Poetry by Qu Yuan and Others

tls:text.tls:line: Who among them can distinguish good from bad in us?“Could it be that people are not all the same in their likes anddislikes?Consider the singular oddity of this cabal—They wear mugwort, filling their sashes with it,And deem wild thoroughwort unwearable. 272“If their eyes cannot tell one plant from another,How could they appraise the quality of jade?74They gather dung and soil into scent bags and wear them,And call Shen pepper unfragrant.”70I wanted to follow Ling Fen’s auspicious oracle,But my heart swithered in doubt.Shaman Xian was bound to descend that evening,So I welcomed her with crossed lapels stuffed with pepperand rice.71280Her spirit crowd, like a vast canopy, descended over us,As the spirits of Nine Doubts thronged to welcome her.The Majestic One manifesting her power in blazing light,Told me why the oracle was auspicious:She said, “Force yourself to ascend and descend, search high andlow,Till you find someone whose try square is as true as yours.Tang and Yu earnestly sought their match in others,And with Zhi and Gao Yao they found harmony.72 288

sense.def: who among them?, which one?; (contrastive) who?

tls:text.tls:line: though I face nine deaths yet will I neverrepent!
though I face nine deaths yet will I neverrepent!

sense.def: even if; even supposing that (as opposed to "although"

tls:text.tls:line: 20 so I fear that anyone admirable must grow old at twilight.

sense.def: old age; late years of decline

seg.line: 苟余情其信姱以練要兮

tls:text.tls:line: But this is what in my heart I know to be right –
On behalf of the pure and untainted, I would die for the straight path –

sense.def: cause to be hiding> hide away

tls:text.tls:line: On behalf of the pure and untainted, I would die for the straight path –
On behalf of the pure and untainted, I would die for the straight path –

sense.def: die for (a ruler etc); sacrifice one's life in the cause or service of N

tls:text.tls:line: On behalf of the pure and untainted, I would die for the straight path –
having stood long in place, now I will go back,

sense.def: linger on; wait in indecision, hesitate, dither

tls:text.tls:line: having stood long in place, now I will go back,
Turning the carriage onto the opposite road –

sense.def: turn (the head); turn round (one's horses etc)

tls:text.tls:line: Turning the carriage onto the opposite road –
112 retreating, I will return to perfect my original apparel:
so long as my own passions are sure and sweet.

sense.def: as long as, given that really; if basically

tls:text.tls:line: ‘Gun lost his life for his honesty and frankness –
‘Gun lost his life for his honesty and frankness –
‘Gun lost his life for his honesty and frankness –

sense.def: destroy one's own life; ruin one's life

tls:text.tls:line: 132 ultimately he perished in the wilds of Mount Plume.
‘Why are you immoderately righteous, so avid of perfection –

sense.def: be candid; be frank; be straightforward in publicspeech

tls:text.tls:line: ‘Why are you immoderately righteous, so avid of perfection –

sense.def: on a large scale; widley; elaborately; with broad objects

tls:text.tls:line: so grandiose and solitary in your proud demeanour?

sense.def: in a tumultuous fashion, in disarray

tls:text.tls:line: so grandiose and solitary in your proud demeanour?

sense.def: idiosyncratically; uniquely;autonomously; independently, on one's own accord, all on one's own initiative

tls:text.tls:line: so grandiose and solitary in your proud demeanour?
so grandiose and solitary in your proud demeanour?
140 so why must you remain alone? Why not heed my words?’

sense.def: be all alone; be isolated; be all separated from the world

tls:text.tls:line: 140 so why must you remain alone? Why not heed my words?’
141 Instead I take the ancient sages as my intermediaries –
141 Instead I take the ancient sages as my intermediaries –
alas, that by following my heart I have come to this!
alas, that by following my heart I have come to this!
129 Lady Xu the Shamaness clings closely to me–
148 so his five sons were ruined in family strife.
‘Archer Yih was a dissolute man who overindulged in hunting –
150 but succeeded in shooting the great boar.

sense.def: like to V, be fond of V-ing

tls:text.tls:line: 150 but succeeded in shooting the great boar.
150 but succeeded in shooting the great boar.
Thus the consequences of rebellion rarely end peaceably –

sense.def: last to the end of one's life

tls:text.tls:line: they adhered to the plumb-line-straight rule without partiality.

sense.def: be (often abstractly) slanted and unbalanced; deviate by one's own authority;

tls:text.tls:line: 168 will be accorded employment in the sublunary realm.

sense.def: as long as, given that really; if basically

tls:text.tls:line: 182 assured of my own mastery of the righteous path:
I wander where I please and roam at leisure.
The worldly are confounded and befouled, envying the talented –

sense.def: have high hopes for; hope (often unrealistically) for; have any realistic hope for

tls:text.tls:line: 101 I grieve for the high hopes of days gone by,
My high aspirations are cut off without hope;
I am disappointed; I have nothing to hope for.
Forgetful of lowly rank and poverty.

sense.def: 老之將至 "the coming arrival of old age" nominaliser converting a sentence with a verbal predicate into an abstract nominalisation (sometimes best rendered in English not with a nominalisation but a that-clause when in object position)

tls:text.tls:line: But I dare not forget the great kindness he once showed me.

sense.def: ADJ 之 N: 得意之色"a facial expression expressing happy satisfaction": marker of the modification of a noun by a deverbal adjectival expression
